markdown:
Namorrodor stalk the night, craving the flesh of the living. Though they dwell on the [Shadow Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=11), the shadowy substances of that plane offer them only the barest sustenance, and they forever seek to cross over onto the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1)— yet they can make this journey only on the eve of a death, and only in a place where their plane overlaps the Material. When they manage to make the leap between planes, a shooting star marks their passage. Attracted by the smell of cooking meat but particularly vulnerable to flame, a namorrodor's most common meal is a traveler who has strayed from their campfire. Unattended babies are a treat so delectable, however, that a namorrodor will risk an encounter with dreaded fire if it spies an opportunity to snatch one. A namorrodor's skin is torn and loose over jutting bones, through which the wind whistles with a distinctive, eerie tone. Able to change between a quadrupedal and bipedal stance, the namorrodor is an admirable hunter. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 20 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 15 [Namorrodor](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1244) **Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 183 **Perception** +11; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [lifesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=21) 30 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +12, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +13, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +14, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +11 **Str** +4 **Dex** +5 **Con** +3 **Int** +3 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +0 **Interplanar Lifesense** While the namorrodor is on the [Shadow Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=11), its lifesense extends to the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1) as a vague sense with a 100-foot range. --- **AC** 22 **Fort** +12 **Ref** +14 **Will** +11 **HP** 85 **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=145) **Weaknesses** positive 5, fire 5 **Whistling Bones** ([auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 30 feet. Wind whistles through the namorrodor's jutting bones with an eerie tone. A creature entering or beginning its turn in the area must attempt a DC 19 Will save, becoming [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19) on a failure (frightened 2 on a critical failure). A creature can't reduce its frightened condition below 1 as long as it's in the aura.
**Material Leap** ([conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [teleportation](/Traits.aspx?ID=156)) **Requirements** The namorrodor is on the [Shadow Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=11) <%END>; **Trigger** A creature the namorrodor can sense with its lifesense on the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1) dies; **Effect** The namorrodor leaps between planes, appearing on the Material Plane within 100 feet of the triggering creature. It remains on the Material Plane for 24 hours, after which it is recalled to its original location on the Shadow Plane.
 --- **Speed** 40 feet **Melee** jaws +15, **Damage** 2d8+6 piercing **Melee** claw +15 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 2d6+6 piercing plus Grab **Ranged** spit +14 ([range 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 1d8+6 bludgeoning **Bounding Sprint** **Requirements** The namorrodor has nothing in its hands; **Effect** The namorrodor bounds forward, using four limbs for an extra burst of speed. It Strides twice and makes a single melee Strike at the end of its movement.
Night Stalkers Since living on the [Shadow Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=11) gives them easy access to broad areas of the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1), tales of namorrodors are told all over the world, from the Storval Plateau's river gorges to the Bandu Hills in northwestern Vidrian, Casmaron's Windswept Wastes, and the river dividing Hongal from the Shaguang desert in Tian Xia. Their names vary, but reports of shooting stars heralding their arrival and their eerie whistling auras are remarkably consistent.
name: Namorrodor
